title: Mixing gases does not change speed

content.question: A <math alttext="1 liter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of helium gas at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="1 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is combined with a <math alttext="1 liter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of neon gas at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="1 atmosphere" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>atm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The temperature is kept constant. Which of the following statements about combining the gases is correct?

choices.label: The average speed of the helium atoms increases when the gases are combined.
The average speed of the neon atoms increases when the gases are combined.
The average kinetic energy of the helium atoms increases when the gases are combined.
The average kinetic energy of the helium atoms and neon atoms do not change when the gases are combined.

content.answer: The average kinetic energy of the helium atoms and neon atoms do not change when the gases are combined.
